content.text:
# Ancient Diocese of Lectoure__disambig_1

Lectoure Cathedral
The former Catholic Diocese of Lectoure was in south-west France. It existed from the fourth century until the time of the French Revolution, when it was suppressed under the Concordat of 1801.[http://www.catholic-hierarchy.org/diocese/dl524.html Lectoure (Diocese) [Catholic-Hierarchy]] Its see was Lectoure Cathedral. Lectoure is now a commune of Gers.
Its territory was divided between the diocese of Agen and the archdiocese of Toulouse.
